meta.line-types: M+LN B B B B L G+CR

tier.item: `She is going to leave it for me, I heard.'
She is going to leave it for me, I heard.
`He doesn't want to get it from you, I heard.'
He doesn't want to get it from you, I heard.
`She gave it to him, I heard.'
She gave it to him, I heard.
`Let's walk to the path in the woods, someone (identifiable) told me.'
Let's walk to the path in the woods, someone (identifiable) told me.
`He said that he (himself) killed the monkey.'
He said that he (himself) killed the monkey.
`She is going to get (something) with you, she herself said.'
She is going to get (something) with you, she herself said.
The house burned, someone (identifiable) told me.
My grandfather was cured.' (it is said)
`The children in the woods, the lynx attacked them.' (it is said)
The children in the woods, the lynx attacked them.' (it is said)
The house burned, someone (identifiable) told me.
`The two have been there.' (I have seen it)
The two have been there.' (I have seen it)
You were beautiful.' (I have seen it)
`She has washed the clothes.' (I have seen it)
She has washed the clothes.' (I have seen it)
`He has been lying down.' (I have seen it)
He has been lying down.' (I have seen it)
`He has been eating with someone.' (I have seen it)
He has been eating with someone.' (I have seen it)
`He is falling.' (we ­ speaker and listener ­ can see it)
He is falling.' (we ­ speaker and listener ­ can see it)
`He is going.' (we ­ speaker and listener ­ can see it)
He is going.' (we ­ speaker and listener ­ can see it)
`They are eating' (we ­ speaker and listener ­ can see it)
They are eating' (we ­ speaker and listener ­ can see it)
He did not eat.' (I saw it)
You saw.' (I saw that you saw)
`It seems that he went, no one is there.'
It seems that he went, no one is there.

meta.line-types: L G L G L G T

tier.item: `It seems that she ate, she left a dirty dish.'
It seems that she ate, she left a dirty dish.
`It is possible that you.PL have washed (sth) for me (because I heard
the sound coming from the river).'
It is possible that you.PL have washed (sth) for me (because I heard
the sound coming from the river).
`It is possible that you.PL have washed.'
It is possible that you.PL have washed.
I (certainly) am going to eat also.
I (certainly) am going to cook soon.
`My grandchildren are going to be happy with me (on my return).'
My grandchildren are going to be happy with me (on my return).
`He is going to eat goat meat.'
He is going to eat goat meat.
house (which we see at a distance)
child (who we see at a distance)
